text: Sam C. Gwynne is an American nonfiction writer.https://scgwynne.com/author ==Life== He was educated at The Hill School. He attended Princeton University and graduated in 1974.https://paw.princeton.edu/article/tiger-week-author-sc- gwynne-%E2%80%9974 He also has a master's degree in writing from Johns Hopkins University, where he studied under novelist John Barth. He served as a Sergeant in the United States Marine Corps Reserve. He lives in Austin, Texas with his wife. He worked for Time magazine, and is senior editor at Texas Monthly.http://www.texasmonthly.com/contributor/sc- gwynnehttp://www.texasmonthly.com/story/qa-s-c-gwynne His 2010 book Empire of the Summer Moon: Quanah Parker and the Rise and Fall of the Comanches was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize in the General Nonfiction category. ==Works== *Selling Money, Weidenfeld & Nicolson, A Division of Wheatland Corporation, 1986, . *Empire of the Summer Moon: Quanah Parker and the Rise and Fall of the Comanches, Little, Brown Book Group, 2011, . * ==Awards== * 1992 Gerald Loeb Award for Magazines for a series of articles on the BCCI scandal ==References== ==External links== *http://www.scgwynne.com/ *http://www.historynet.com/interview-with-author-s-c-gwynne.htm * Category:Living people Category:Time (magazine) people Category:People from Austin, Texas Category:American male writers Category:The Hill School alumni Category:Princeton University alumni Category:Gerald Loeb Award winners for Magazines Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
